message.content:
cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.RO, cs.CG, cs.GT. 

This paper deals with the problem of finding a hidden treasure in a plane using a mobile agent, which involves algorithmic techniques for optimization and decision-making. This makes it likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. Additionally, the problem involves geometric considerations and optimization of trajectories, which suggests it could also belong to the Computational Geometry (cs.CG) and Robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses tradeoffs between cost and information, which could be seen as a game-theoretic problem, making it possible to belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category.
